title: US to Give Lebanon Unmanned Aircraft

content: If you need a good example of “sleeping with a snake” this is it. Lebanon is no ally of the USA nor of Israel. I can only bet Israel is just thrilled at this latest news. It will be only a matter of time as to when these aircraft are used against the USA and/or Israel. The decision to provide military aid to Lebanon is questionable at best. We must never forget the Marine Barracks that was blown up in this country to the surprise of many in Washington. Sometimes it takes these types of actions to get the USA to blink. Now that the USA appears to have a President that mirrors President Jimmy Carter, we can expect another attention getter to happen as it did for President Carter. However, we do not yet have another President Reagan waiting in the wings to fix it, and you can bet there will be a lot of fixing necessary in 2012. RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,189056,00.html

content: The article stated Russia has recently given Lebanon Mig 29's and you're worried about the US giving some 4 1/2 pound Raven UAV''s?????? The Raven is strictly a survellience. "Weighing in at four and a half pounds with a five-foot wingspan and stretching a mere 38 inches in length, the Raven is by far one of the smallest vehicles in the Army, but its aerial reconnaissance value has quickly earned the respect of battalion commanders in Iraq and has filled a niche at the battalion level when larger UAVs are unavailable". These things are not a rarity anymore. Turkey has them, Israel has them and a dollar to a donut says Syria has them. Probably Hizbullah has the Iranian variety.

content: It was only time that this was going to happen. In short time older model A "Predators" will be used by the State Department to help shore up failing governments that this nation and other western nations will rely on for the raw materials our economies require. I'm developing a single-engine turboprop into a tanker that will be able to refuel such lower cost UAV systems. This tanker will be able to carry over 300 gallons and operate at airspeeds below 100 knots and cost less than $5 million dollars using off-the-shelf general aviation aircraft. This technology will now allow second and third tier governments to "join" the aerial refueling club. Anyone wanting to learn more I'm at raveneye58@hotmail.com my name is Alan I'm the inventor and test pilot who worked out the technology.
